Articles

Keep dancing after the Strictly final with our Freegal digital music service

Written by Lisa Brennan · Published Dec 17, 2016

The 2016 series of Strictly Come Dancing draws to a close this weekend. If it's put you in the mood to dance, why not use your library card to access some of the great music we have available online?

Get into the Christmas spirit with our Freegal digital music service

Written by Lisa Brennan · Published Dec 5, 2016

Getting into the spirit of the season, holding a Christmas party, or looking for music to listen to while opening your presents? Look no further than these digital titles you can access for free with your library card

Looking for Christmas inspiration? Check out our Christmas 2016 suggestions.

Written by Leon Paternoster · Published Dec 2, 2016

What better gift than a book, album or film for Christmas? Whoever the gift is for, we've got loads of ideas for you.

Have a home-made Christmas with the help of our digital magazines

Written by Lisa Brennan · Published Dec 1, 2016

Deck the halls and spoil your Christmas guests with the help of free titles from our digital magazine service, Zinio

Funny titles to bring some cheer to the end of 2016

Written by Brandon King · Published Nov 29, 2016

2016 has been a tough year in many respects. Why not get away from all the problems and curl up with a funny book? Here are a few suggestions.

Top Freegal titles to celebrate the life, music and influence of Freddie Mercury

Written by Lisa Brennan · Published Nov 24, 2016

To mark 25 years since the death of legendary Queen frontman Freddie Mercury, we've picked some great music you can listen to for free with your library card

Local interest for November 2016

Written by Brandon King · Published Nov 10, 2016

Bury St Edmunds Abbey, the Mildenhall Treasure, the origins of Lowestoft, 18th and 19th century life and trade and desperate times in a farming family feature in our latest Suffolk fiction and non-fiction titles.

Taking on NaNoWriMo? Let us help!

Written by Alice Violett · Published Nov 3, 2016

Once again, aspiring wordsmiths around the world are furiously scribbling or tapping away for National Novel Writing Month. We hope our advice books and writing groups can help Suffolk 'wrimos' smash the 50,000-word target. You can even publish your work afterwards using our Suffolk Writes service.

What will you do as a Reading Ambassador?

Written by Alice Violett · Published Oct 27, 2016

The Publishers’ Association are looking for book-lovers to spread the joys of reading in their communities by becoming Reading Ambassadors. We’ve come up with a few ideas of how you might promote reading for pleasure as a Reading Ambassador.

Well done Candice! What fabulous books have previous Bake Off winners created?

Written by Alice Violett · Published Oct 26, 2016

Last night, Candice was crowned the winner of the 2016 Great British Bake Off. We hope she and the other finalists will join the ranks of several previous contestants, who have written inspiring books you can borrow from Suffolk Libraries.
